headline: Don't Let Balloons Float Up and Take Down Power This Valentine's Day
summary: As Valentine's Day approaches, FirstEnergy Corp. (NYSE: FE) is reminding customers to handle helium-filled foil balloons safely to keep power flowing this season and year-round. Foil balloons cause power outages when released outdoors because their metallic coating conducts electricity and poses a risk to the electric system.

content.title: Don't Let Balloons Float Up and Take Down Power This Valentine's Day
content.summary: As Valentine's Day approaches, FirstEnergy Corp. (NYSE: FE) is reminding customers to handle helium-filled foil balloons safely to keep power flowing this season and year-round. Foil balloons cause power outages when released outdoors because their metallic coating conducts electricity and poses a risk to the electric system.

thumbnail.caption: February typically marks the onset of an increase in outages caused by metallic balloons, as they float off from Valentine's Day gifts. In 2024, foil balloons were to blame for 109 power outages across FirstEnergy's service area.
